content: (3931) Technical Guide 9.2.2 Main memory IBM z16 memory consists of the following features:  Up to 48 DIMM are used per drawer in two rows (40 TB system maximum): – Organized in 8-channel Reed-Solomon RAIM groups • 50% reduced RAIM overhead (compared to IBM z15) • RAIM protection (similar to IBM z15) – Up to three chip marks and one channel mark – DDR4 DRAM with on chip power regulation: N+1 voltage regulators – Standard Open Memory Interface (OMI); up to six OMI per drawer: • CRC/Retry for soft errors • Degrade bus lanes from four lanes to two lanes on hard error – No waiting for all eight RAIM channels, use first seven to respond: • RAIM recovery is used to enhance performance without affecting RAS • Processor uses data from the first seven channels to respond • Refetch data by using all eight RAIM channels if an error occurs  Flexible memory: – Provides more physical memory DIMMs that are needed to support activation of all customer-purchased memory and HSA on a multiple drawer

metadata.title: IBM z16 (3931) Technical Guide
